shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Śǝrˤatä qǝddase “Order of the Mass” (fols. 1ra l.1–30va l.12), incomplete, the beginning is missing II) Anaphoras (fols. 30vb–146rb) II-1) Anaphora of the Apostles (fols. 30vb l.1–44vb l.4) II-2) Anaphora of Our Lord Jesus Christ (fols. 44vb l.5–49vb l.11) II-3) Anaphora of St. John, Son of Thunder (fols. 50ra l.1–63va l.12) II-4) Anaphora of Our Lady by St. Cyriacus of Behnesa (fols. 64ra l.1–77rb l.8). The Anaphora is preceded by a passage (fol. 63vb) looking like an introductory invocation of St. Mary and saints. II-5) Anaphora of St. John Chrysostom (fols. 77va l.1–84va l.6) II-6) Anaphora of the 318 Orthodox Fathers of Nicaea (fols. 84va l.7–95vb l.4) II-7) Anaphora of St. Gregory of Nyssa (“Hosanna-liturgy of St. Gregory”) (fols. 95vb l.5–109rb l.10) II-8) Anaphora of St. Dioscorus of Alexandria (fols. 109rb l.11–112vb l.6) II-9) Anaphora of St. Jacob of Serug (fols. 112vb l.7–121ra l.12) II-10) Anaphora of St. Athanasius of Alexandria (fols. 121rb l.1–135rb l.7) II-11) Anaphora of St. Basil of Caesarea (fols. 135rb l.8 – 140vb l.14, 144ra l.1 – 144vb l.14, 146ra l.1–146rb l.9).
Additiones 1-5.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. is very worn. Some folios are missing, some are misplaced. In the end part of the Ms. (quires XVI and XVII) leaves are bound in the wrong order, with a number of guest texts originating from other Mss. Many leaves are heavily stained with dirt, on certain folios the text is difficult to read.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (the front board is missing, substituted with a newspaper sheet); Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Cross crudely engraved on the back cover.

bnothers.bnother: Traces of the chains of endband stitches at the spine cover (small holes visible in the spine fold of the quires).

squires.squire:
I(10/fols. 1r-10v) – II(10/fols. 11r-19v) – III(10/fols. 21r-30v) – IV(10/fols. 31r-40v) – V(10/fols. 41r-50v) – VI(10/fols. 51r-60v) – VII(10/fols. 61r-70v) – VIII(10/fols. 71r-80v) – IX(10/fols. 81r-90v) – X(10/fols. 91r-100v) – XI(10/fols. 101r-110v) – XII(10/fols. 111r-120v) – XIII(10/fols. 121r-130v) – XIV(10/fols. 131r-140v) – <XV(3/fols. 141r-143v)> – XVI(2/fols. 144r-145v) – XVII(6/fols. 146r-151v)
In some of the quires (e. g., I, XIV), the leaves are held together by means of additional crude sewing stitches. Folios 141-143, making up quire XV, were taken out of a different Ms. In the end part of the Ms. (quires XVI and XVII) leaves are bound in the wrong order. Starting from fol. 144v, the correct sequence for the Anaphora of St. Basil of Caesarea would be as follows: fols. 144v – 148r – 148v – 147r – 147v – 146r.

taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are mostly visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible (s. fol. 105r). Ruling pricks are partly visible (s. fol. 43r). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Fine, regular, by a well-trained hand.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the reigning king, patriarch and metropolitan; groups of lines on the incipit pages of texts, alternating with black lines; initial words of minor texts; directives for the ministers; elements of the punctuation signs; most of the abbreviations.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ይካ፡ for ይብል፡ ካህን፡ ይዲ፡ for ይብል፡ ዲያቆን፡ ይሕ፡ for ይብል፡ ሕዝብ፡ ቅ፡ ቅ፡ ቅዱስ፡ or ቅዱስ፡ ቅ፡ ቅ፡ for ቅዱስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ (s. fols. 17va, l.13; 22rb, l.9)

additional.cont: Fols. 141r-142r: Märgämä kəbr "Refutation of the Glory", a didactic poem.
additional.det: A didactic poem in Old Amharic, most probably incomplete, possibly a fragment of a different manuscript. The text is written in a late 17th-/early 18th-cent. hand (similar, but not identical to the main hand of the Ms.). The title of the poem appears in the upper margin. The poem shows striking similarity, in both the content and style, to "an archaic Amharic poem" published by Getatchew Haile ("An Archaic Amharic Poem on Condemning Wealth and Glory", in: G.Khan, Semitic Studies in Honour of Edward Ullendorff, Leiden - Boston 2005, 255-75); still, this "Refutation of the Glory" is a different text.

additional.cont: Fol. 143ra-143vb: Prayer over the blessed bread (eulogia), two prayers after meals.
additional.det: The prayers are probably connected with the consuming of the eulogia by celebrant clergy at the end of Mass.

additional.cont: Fol. 145v: Prayer before the liturgical reading from the Gospel (cp. MQ I, ch. 3, 186).
additional.det: This text is absent from its proper place in fol. 23rb. In fol. 145v it is written in a different hand.

additional.cont: Fols. 151r-151v-150r-150v: Prayers before the reading from the Miracles of Mary (cp. fol. 151vb).
additional.det: Written in two different hands, in the reversed direction.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: Blue thread is inserted in the right upper corner of fol. 30v.
